titleStmt.title: ❧ To the thrice high and puissant Prince, King IAMES.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: ❧ To the thrice high and puissant Prince, King IAMES.

monogr.title: Thrēnōdia. Siue Pandionium melos, in perpetuam serenissimæ simul ac beatissimæ Principis Annæ nuper Angliæ Reginæ memoriam : Elegies and epitaphs, by W.S. late seruant and chaplaine to her Maiestie
monogr.author: Slatyer, William

div.head: ❧ To the thrice high and puissant Prince, King IAMES.

lg.l: With curious eye, view not these Pourtraitures;
I haue (deare Liege) your losse, limm'd, shadowed thus.
Let but my loue, which me of grace assures
Leaue thus farre forth obtaine, that Zoilus
In person of Apelles iudge not this:
AM I a Zeuxis, true colours not to misse?
Some polisht style, some fine and searching wits,
Liuing in Athens subtile temperate ayre,
True, Royall Lord. Rude rythmes with vs are rare:
Your Highnesse though t'accept what Mantua offers,
ARmour of proofe t'will be gainst enuious scoffers.
